Comparison with Pennsylvania: The expert verified the claim by confirming that Pennsylvania does indeed have 23 foreign trade offices covering 67 countries, supporting the statement made by Lt. Gov. Kim Guadagno about the number of offices in Pennsylvania.
Existence of previous offices: The expert found evidence that contradicted the claim that New Jersey did not have any foreign trade offices for the past decade. They listed ten full- and part-time overseas offices that were in operation during the past decade, providing specific details about the locations and time periods of these offices.
Opening of new offices: The expert confirmed the opening of new foreign trade offices in Shanghai and London in the past six months through a joint effort between the New Jersey Economic Development Authority and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. They provided information about the number of staff members stationed in each office.
Impact on exports: The expert challenged the claim that the opening of the two new offices led to an 18 percent increase in exports. They stated that there was no evidence to support this claim and suggested that other factors might have contributed to the increase in exports.
